Project Nature: "(T26) 1. Duties: "- Serve a contract assignment under InfoTech's headcount, full-time second to serve the E&MSD; ;A. To provide application support including liaison with users and vendors, monitoring, repairing, recovering application systems, training and application support to BI platform users;;G. To take lead in the study and planning for streamlining the data flow to ensure high data quality;;H. To prepare and to update system design documents which includes, but not limited to, operation procedures, system configuration documents, drill plans, contingency plans, technical reports and user manuals;;I. To ensure project deliverables to be completed timely and meeting appropriate quality standard; and;J. To perform other IT services or tasks as assigned by supervisor. ;"
Requirements: "I. Degree in computer subjects or related disciplines;;II. Strong and practical knowledge as well as solid experience in application system and database design and implementation;;VI. Strong knowledge in data presentation and analytics;;IX. Good writing, communication and presentation skills in English and Chinese;;X. At least 3 years' experience in Microsoft SQL Server (MSS); ;. At least 3 years' experience in Information System Study (ISS); ;. At least 2 years' experience in IT Planning (ITP); ;. At least 2 years' experience in Security Risk Assessment and Audit (SAA); ;. At least 2 years' experience in Geographic Information System (GIS); ;. At least 1 year's experience in Web Services (WSV); ;. 1 year's experience in Web Programming (WEB) is an advantage; ;. 1 year's experience in Data Architecture (DAR) is an advantage. ;Non-technical Skills: ;. At least 5 years' experience in work with the Government (GOV); ;. At least 5 years' experience in the management and support of Government systems and services (GSS); ;. At least 5 years' experience in managing Government projects (MGP); ;. At least 5 years' experience in IT service/outsourcing management (OUT); ;. At least 5 years' experience in vendor management (VMG); ;. At least 3 years' experience in contract administration (CON); ;. At least 3 years' experience in project management (PRM); ;. At least 3 years' experience in tender preparation and administration (TPA); ;. At least 3 years' experience in Government tendering procedures (GTP); ;. At least 2 years' experience in Government procurement/disposal procedures (GPD). ;- Bachelor's degree/Higher Diploma in Computer Science, IT or equivalent; ;- At least 12 years' post-qualification experience in which at least 5 years' relevant experience in a similar post and in a comparable capacity."

Project Nature: "(T26) Upgrade of Integrated Law and Order Statistical System and support the Departmental IT Security Risk Assessment and Audit for Security Bureau (SB)"
Duties: "- Serve a contract assignment under InfoTech's headcount, full-time second to serve the SBU; ;The appointed staff is required to: ;a) participate in the project ""Upgrade of Integrated Law and Order Statistical System"" and other minor enhancements for IT systems of SB; ;b) participate in system development lifecycle (SDLC) activities including but not limited to feasibility study, user requirement collection, system analysis & design, system implementation, system testing (unit test, integration test, UAT, etc.), data conversion, system migration and deployment; ;c) monitor project schedule and quality of project deliverables; ;d) liaise with different parties (including users, vendors, computer operators) in user requirement collection, system development and problem investigation for IT systems; ;e) produce/maintain system documentation; ;f) provide helpdesk and onsite IT support to end-users; ;g) provide technical advices for IT systems; ;h) assist in IT security risk assessment & audit; and ;i) perform any other duties assigned by supervisors. ; ;Remark: Overtime work and on-call support outside office hours may be required. ;"
Requirements: "The appointed staff should have: ;a) degree in computer subjects or related disciplines; ;b) hands-on experience in web-based application development with Java programming; ;c) good knowledge of Java Enterprise Edition, web programming and HTML; ;d) experience in project management; ;e) exposure in government regulations, guidelines and procedures, such as Security Regulations (SR), Stores and Procurement Regulations (SPR), Baseline IT Security Policy (S17), IT Security Guidelines (G3) and SOA-QPS5 etc.; ;f) good command of written and spoken English and Chinese; ;g) good communication skills and customer service skills; ;h) independent, self-motivated and good sense of responsibility; and ;i) pleasant personality and good interpersonal skills. ;Technical Skills: ;. At least 5 years' experience in IT Application Development and Management (ADM); ;. At least 5 years' experience in JAVA Programming (JAV); ;. At least 5 years' experience in J2EE Development (JDE); ;. At least 4 years' experience in Web Programming (WEB); ;. At least 3 years' experience in HTML5 (HT5); ;. At least 3 years' experience in Structured Query Language (SQL); ;. At least 3 years' experience in JavaServer Faces (JSF) (JSF); ;. 2 years' experience in Project Management Professional (PMP) (PMP) is an advantage; ;. 2 years' experience in PRINCE (PRE) is an advantage; ;. 2 years' experience in Security Risk Assessment and Audit (SAA) is an advantage; ;. 2 years' experience in System Implementation and Maintenance/Support (SIM) is an advantage; ;. 2 years' experience in DB2 (DB2) is an advantage; ;. 2 years' experience in Function Point Analysis (FPA) is an advantage; ;. 2 years' experience in Windows Server 2008/2012 (W12) is an advantage; ;. 2 years' experience in HTML version before HTML5 (HTM) is an advantage; ;. 2 years' experience in IT Security (ITS) is an advantage; ;. 1 year's experience in Web Hosting, Design and Maintenance (WED) is an advantage; ;. 1 year's experience in Crystal Report (CRE) is an advantage. ;Non-technical Skills: ;. At least 3 years' experience in customer service (CLS); ;. At least 2 years' experience in work with the Government (GOV); ;. At least 2 years' experience in project management (PRM); ;. 1 year's experience in IT procurement (PRO) is an advantage; ;. 1 year's experience in the management and support of Government systems and services (GSS) is an advantage; ;. 1 year's experience in IT audit (ITA) is an advantage; ;. 1 year's experience in IT service/outsourcing management (OUT) is an advantage. ;- Bachelor's degree/Higher Diploma in Computer Science, IT or equivalent; ;- At least 6 years' post-qualification experience in which at least 3 years' relevant experience in a similar post and in a comparable capacity."

Project Nature: "(T26) (I) Maintenance and enhancement of the existing electronic system for selected RGC funding schemes, including adding, modifying, or enhancing system functions, troubleshooting system issues, and providing user support for daily system operations."
Duties: "- Serve a contract assignment under InfoTech's headcount, full-time second to serve the UGC; ;(I) For the existing systems, the duties include the following: ;1. Perform routine maintenance on the existing electronic system to ensure optimal performance and reliability; ;2. Identify and troubleshoot system issues, implementing solutions to resolve problems promptly and minimize downtime; ;3. Add, modify, and enhance system functions based on user feedback and evolving requirements to improve overall system functionality; ;4. Provide user support for daily operations, assisting staff with system-related inquiries and resolving operational challenges; ;5. Work closely with subject teams in the Department and business users to ensure technical compatibility and user satisfaction; ; ;(II) To assist with the new system project, including system analysis and design (SA&D), programming, implementation, data migration, testing, system monitoring, and maintenance. Detail of the duties include: ;1. Carry out quality control and quality assurance, to scrutinize project reports and specifications; ;2. Assist in gathering user requirements and conducting related analysis; ;3. Assist in data migration from legacy systems to the new platform, ensuring data integrity and accuracy; ;4. Conduct thorough data checks to verify that migrated data is complete and correctly formatted; ;5. To assist in the system/UAT testing; ;"
Requirements: "Requirement Details: ;1. Have a bachelor degree in Computer Sciences or related disciplines ;2. Have good written skills in Chinese and English and fluent in these spoken languages ;3. Proficient in SQL, with the ability to write complex queries and optimize database performance ;4. Strong skills in Java and JSP for developing and enhancing web applications ;5. Experience with WildFly application server for deploying and managing Java applications ;6. Proficiency in both MySQL and MSSQL database management systems, including installation, configuration, and maintenance ;7. Familiarity with Linux operating systems, including command-line usage and basic system administration tasks ;8. Experience in data migration and data synchronization between systems is highly preferable, ensuring data consistency and integrity ;9. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail, with a commitment to delivering high-quality results in a fast-paced environment ;10. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, effectively communicating technical concepts to non-technical user ;11. Have project development experience in funding scheme system is an advantage ;12. Quick to respond to user requests, demonstrating a solid understanding of their needs and providing timely solutions ;13. Preference will be given to those who have working experience in the HKSAR Government projects ;Technical Skills: ;. At least 5 years' experience in JAVA Programming (JAV); ;. At least 5 years' experience in Java Servlet Programming (JSP); ;. At least 5 years' experience in JavaScript Programming (JAP); ;. At least 5 years' experience in Structured Query Language (SQL); ;. At least 3 years' experience in MySQL (MSQ); ;. 5 years' experience in IT Application Development and Management (ADM) is an advantage; ;. 5 years' experience in HTML version before HTML5 (HTM) is an advantage; ;. 5 years' experience in Java Application Framework (e.g. Struts (Apache)) (JAF) is an advantage; ;. 5 years' experience in System Implementation and Maintenance/Support (SIM) is an advantage; ;. 1 year's experience in Windows Server 2008/2012 (W12) is an advantage; ;. 1 year's experience in JBoss Application Server (JAS) is an advantage; ;. 1 year's experience in Apache Web Server (AWS) is an advantage; ;. 1 year's experience in Data Management (DMT) is an advantage; ;. 1 year's experience in Microsoft SQL Server (MSS) is an advantage; ;. 1 year's experience in SQL*PLUS/PL/SQL/PRO*C (OPL) is an advantage. ;Non-technical Skill: ;. 1 year's experience in work with the Government (GOV) is an advantage. ;- Bachelor's degree/Higher Diploma in Computer Science, IT or equivalent; ;- At least 6 years' post-qualification experience in which at least 3 years' relevant experience in a similar post and in a comparable capacity."

Project Nature: "(T26) To serve the DPO for supporting the National Games Coordination Office (Hong Kong) for the IT application for the 15th National Games, the 12th National Games for People with Disabilities and the 9th National Special Olympics Games (""the Games"")"
Duties: "- Serve a contract assignment under InfoTech's headcount, full-time second to serve the DPO; ;- Assist in System Analysis & Design, System implementation and support for the IT systems, in particular for the Games Management System (GMS), required in the Games ;- Assist in implementation, integration, administration, technical support and trouble-shooting for the IT systems, in particular for the GMS ;- Assist in project progress monitoring, user coordination, requirement gathering, management of contractor performance, project progress review, quality assurance of project deliverables, acceptance testing, security risk assessment & audit and privacy impact assessment ;- Liaise and coordinate with stakeholders in Hong Kong and Guangdong Province in supporting the installation, integration and operation of IT systems in various venues ;- Provide technical expertise in system implementation and ensure the IT systems meeting the needs of the Games ;- Ensure projects can be implemented in compliance with numerous policy and guidelines ;- Oversee the transition of IT services between different phases of the Games ;- Work outside office hours and provide on-call production support ;- Undertake other IT-related duties assigned by supervisor ;"
Requirements: "- Possess at least 4 years' experience in system implementation and administration ;- Possess at least 1 year's experience in system implementation and administration of Games Management System (GMS) for large sports events ;- Holders of Project Management Professional (PMP) (valid or expired) is required; Experience in managing projects will definitely be an advantage ;- Possess good written communication skill in English and Chinese ;- Good command in spoken English and Putonghua is required ;Technical Skills: ;. Good spoken English is a must; ;. Good Putonghua is a must; ;. Good written English is a must; ;. 1 year's experience in project management (PRM) is an advantage; ;. Good coordination skills is an advantage. ;- Bachelor's degree/Higher Diploma in Computer Science, IT or equivalent; ;- At least 4 years' post-qualification experience in which at least 1 year's relevant experience in a similar post and in a comparable capacity."

Project Nature: "(T26) Outsourcing, development, implementation and support of application systems for promoting Construction, Digital, administrating multiple Building Information Modelling (BIM) related hardware and software, developing departmental BIM Common Data Collaboration Platform (CDCP), pilot SCADA Replicator System for E&MB and reprovision of CAVE system at DS Tower for BIM Support Team."
Duties: "- Serve a contract assignment under InfoTech's headcount, full-time second to serve the DSD; ;Systems Analyst is mainly deployed to perform the following duties:;;1. To assist in the implementation of Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition system (SCADA) replicator system in E&MB for collecting readings to the centralized database for visualization in Departmental BIM Visualization Platform;;2. To collect and consolidate the user and functional requirements and administrate the implementation and further enhancement of the departmental CDCP platform, check and upkeep the server structures for housing design/as-built BIM models and liaise with other teams to provide network and computer support services;;3. To render advices and conduct business process engineering, if necessary, to optimize effectiveness of business processes related to the CDCP;;4. To design and develop the requirements for procuring vendor services for Application Programming Interface (API) of BIM software to improve the workflow and efficiency of BIM authoring and checking with the integration with CDCP;;5. To oversee the application of and manage the BIM software inventory and related hardware;;6. Prepare tender documents for implementing enhancements for the existing applications and new IT systems;;7. To coordinate with and support colleagues on the Cave Automatic Virtual Environment (CAVE), CDCP, BIM authoring software, point cloud viewer and Virtual Reality (VR) applications;;8. To oversee the reprovision fo CAVE system at the new DS tower and relevant contract administration.;9. Support user acceptance test and provide user training on IT systems; and;10. To perform any other duties assigned by senior officers. ;"
Requirements: "Systems Analyst must have;1. Holder of a Bachelor degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related disciplines;;2. Have attained Level 2 or above in Chinese Language and English Language in the Hong Kong Certificate of Education Examination (HKCEE) or equivalent; ;(N.B.: Grade E in Chinese Language and English Language (Syllabus B) in previous HKCEE is accepted administratively as comparable to Level 2 in Chinese Language and English Language in the 2007 HKCEE and henceforth.);3. Proficient in managing IT development projects and managing/overseeing day-to-day operations of web-based systems;;4. Have at least two years&;#8217; experience on IT service procurement, contract monitoring, user management, quality assurance and IT security audit, and management of multiple IT projects,;5. He/she should be proficient in documenting user and functional requirements in English; and;6. Knowledge on immersive CAVE, SCADA, BIM and GIS is preferred. ;Technical Skills: ;. At least 5 years' experience in IT Application Development and Management (ADM); ;. At least 4 years' experience in System Implementation and Maintenance/Support (SIM); ;. At least 3 years' experience in Document Flow/Workflow Management System (DOC); ;. At least 2 years' experience in Information System Study (ISS); ;. At least 1 year's experience in Web Services (WSV); ;. At least 1 year's experience in Structured Query Language (SQL); ;. 1 year's experience in Web Programming (WEB) is an advantage; ;. 1 year's experience in Geographic Information System (GIS) is an advantage; ;. 1 year's experience in Data Architecture (DAR) is an advantage; ;. 1 year's experience in Data Modeling (DMO) is an advantage. ;Non-technical Skills: ;. At least 5 years' experience in work with the Government (GOV); ;. At least 5 years' experience in the management and support of Government systems and services (GSS); ;. At least 3 years' experience in managing Government projects (MGP); ;. At least 3 years' experience in IT service/outsourcing management (OUT); ;. At least 3 years' experience in quality assurance (QAS); ;. At least 3 years' experience in vendor management (VMG); ;. At least 3 years' experience in Business Process Re-engineering (BPE); ;. At least 3 years' experience in Business Process Modeling (BPM). ;- Bachelor's degree/Higher Diploma in Computer Science, IT or equivalent; ;- At least 10 years' post-qualification experience in which at least 5 years' relevant experience in a similar post and in a comparable capacity."

Project Nature: "(T26) To assist the Judiciary in taking forward the design and development work for the implementation of projects under the IT Strategy Plan, and providing ongoing support of the production systems."
Duties: "- Serve a contract assignment under InfoTech's headcount, full-time second to serve the Judiciary; ;The candidate will be responsible for the following tasks. ;- Lead the framework development team in designing and implementing a microservices architecture using React (frontend) and Spring Boot (backend). ;- Provide ongoing support and maintenance for existing frameworks (JSF and EJB) and the new frameworks in microservices architecture, including scheduled/unscheduled maintenance outside normal office hours. ;- Oversee the setup and management of CI/CD pipelines to ensure efficient deployment processes. ;- Manage the deployment of applications in a Kubernetes environment. ;- Implement single sign-on with identity and access management for authentication and authorization using OAuth2. ;- Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and ensure meeting the project objectives. ;- Ensure adherence to best practices and standards in software development, security, and project management for the Judiciary. ;- Perform other tasks as assigned by the supervisor. ;"
Requirements: "Other than the requirements specified in the 'Technical' and 'non-Technical' Requirement Sections below. ;- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. ;- Minimum of 4 years of management experience in software development or related area. ;- Proven track record in leading software development teams, particularly in architecture roles. ;- Strong proficiency in both frontend and backend technologies. ;- Knowledge on various application libraries/frameworks such as React, Spring Boot, JSF, and EJB with practical experience in using any of these technologies in system design and development. ;- Knowledge on the following technologies and experience in at least one of them ; * setting up and managing CI/CD pipelines. ; * container orchestration using Kubernetes. ; * Keycloak and OAuth2 for authentication and authorization. ;- Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to work effectively under pressure. ;- Strong communication and leadership skills. ;Technical Skills: ;. At least 4 years' experience in Java Application Framework (e.g. Struts (Apache)) (JAF); ;. At least 4 years' experience in JAVA Programming (JAV); ;. At least 4 years' experience in J2EE Development (JDE); ;. At least 4 years' experience in Web Services (WSV); ;. 4 years' experience in IT Application Development and Management (ADM) is an advantage; ;. 4 years' experience in HTML5 (HT5) is an advantage; ;. 4 years' experience in IT Planning (ITP) is an advantage. ;Non-technical Skills: ;. Good written English is a must; ;. 4 years' experience in work with the Government (GOV) is an advantage; ;. 4 years' experience in managing Government projects (MGP) is an advantage. ;- Bachelor's degree/Higher Diploma in Computer Science, IT or equivalent; ;- At least 8 years' post-qualification experience in which at least 4 years' relevant experience in a similar post and in a comparable capacity."
